intro: Pisonia laxiflora, commonly known as the silky pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Pisonia laxiflora is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and sandy soils.
